input_text:
Job Title: Machinist/Programmer

Location: Addison, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Jobot, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

Well established Manufacturing client is seeking an experienced Machinist/Programmer to join their growing team!

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Ryan Anderson

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.

Salary: $25 - $35 per hour

A bit about us:

We are currently seeking a dynamic and highly skilled Machinist/Programmer to join our manufacturing team. This is a full-time, permanent position that offers an exciting opportunity to work in a fast-paced, technologically advanced environment. You will have the chance to work on a variety of projects, from small batch parts to large-scale manufacturing operations. If you are passionate about CNC machinery and have a keen eye for detail, we would love to hear from you.

Why join us?

Competitive rates and comprehensive benefits program!

Job Details

Responsibilities:

As a Machinist/Programmer, your primary responsibilities will include:

 Programming and operating CNC mills and lathes using Mastercam software to produce high-quality parts and components. Setting up and adjusting CNC machines to ensure accurate production. Analyzing and interpreting complex blueprints, drawings, and specifications to accurately program CNC machines. Performing regular maintenance on CNC machines to ensure optimal performance. Collaborating with the manufacturing team to improve processes and increase efficiency. Inspecting and measuring finished products to ensure they meet quality standards and specifications. Troubleshooting and resolving issues with CNC machines and programs. Keeping up-to-date with the latest machining and programming techniques and technologies.

Qualifications:

To be considered for the Machinist/Programmer position, candidates must possess the following qualifications:

 A minimum of 2 years of experience as a CNC Machinist/Programmer in a manufacturing environment. Proficiency in using Mastercam software for programming CNC mills and lathes. Strong understanding of CNC machine setup and operation. Experience in manufacturing small batch parts. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot issues with CNC machines and programs. Strong attention to detail and the ability to produce high-quality work. Ability to read, interpret, and work from blueprints, drawings, and specifications. Excellent communication and teamwork skills. A commitment to maintaining a safe and clean work environment. Physical stamina and the ability to lift heavy objects.

This is a fantastic opportunity for a skilled Machinist/Programmer to join a forward-thinking company that values innovation, quality, and teamwork. If you meet the above qualifications and are ready to take your career to the next level, we encourage you to apply.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
